bio: I am a Cloud SRE Engineer, my core business is about cloud-native infrastructures. I’m an expert Linux OS engineer, with good knowledge of containerization techniques and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Currently I'm architecting, deploying and managing cloud-native applications and high availability infrastructures on AWS. I'm a former software developer and I have a lot of expertise with web applications, APIs, systems integrations, OS managing and bash scripting on OS Linux. I follow and promote DevOps philosophy and I have expertise with tools like Git, Github, Gitlab, Bitbucket, Drone, Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation, Helm, Pulumi. I ran several initiative useful to promote DevOps philosophy and SRE into companies I've worked with. I follow ITIL 4 best practices and Agile Methodologies (Scrum, Kanban). I'm a Certified Kubernetes Application Developer, AWS Solution Architect Associate Certified and ITIL 4 Foundation Certified. I have experience in managing people.
udemy: I'm the owner of the Udemy course 'Introduzione a Cloud & DevOps per la Digital Transformation'.
poc: Technologies used for building this website: Kubernetes (K3S) with Helm on Oracle Cloud for the infrastructure tier, GitHub Actions for the CI, Docker & docker-compose for the containerization tier in dev environment, Gunicorn, Flask, Python, HTML, CSS and JavaScript for the application tier.

0.description: I’ve analyzed and developed web applications and APIs, managed Linux OS, with a deep experience with unattended and embedded solutions. I worked also as IT Project Manager for all the projects I’ve been involved. Every project was managed with Agile Methodologies following ITIL best practices. Relevant Projects: Chatbots, Web Application focused on managing complex workflows of patients in healthcare facilities, Kiosk’s devices software reversioning.

1.role: DevOps & Cloud Engineer – Tech Team Lead
1.description: I've managed the whole developers team of the company, both Web Applications and API developers and developers working on kiosk’s and embedded devices. I've managed and architected scalable and high availability Cloud solutions on AWS. I’ve introduced DevOps solutions and CI/CD with tools like Docker, Ansible and Bitbucket. I've managed company systems and internal software. I've been part of the team focused on continuous improvement and company’s workflow revisions. I took care of making all the estimates and analysis related to IT projects, managing them until they’re realized, often working directly on code. Relevant Projects: unattended kiosk’s payment solutions.

2.description: I was in charge as tech lead of prenotami.cloud, a cloud SaaS solution resulting from a deep architectural revision of several legacy on-premise-designed softwares, made for guarantee horizontal scalability and high availability and high reliability in AWS Cloud. I've architected the system infrastructure on AWS, decoupling a monolithic web application in several services, in order to reach a SOA scalable solution. I've used chroot jails and Docker as containerization tools. I've studied and realized a CI pipeline using Bitbucket Pipelines and a CD system using Ansible as automation platform. I've used Locust.io as load & stress testing platform. I've configured and used several AWS services, both for building the infrastructure (ELB, EC2, RDS, Route53, API GW, Lambda, etc.) and operations and monitoring (CloudWatch). This project was managed with Agile methodology, with Scrum pattern and one-week or ten-days sprints.

3.description: I was part of the team involved in automation of the software that is implemented for platforms used by Fastweb for manage network services. I managed microservices applications with Docker containers, I took care of the creation of the Kubernetes resources necessary for the applications and of the deploy through Helm. I have also carried out E2E automatic tests using Robot Framework. I have applied DevOps using CI/CD pipelines on Gitlab, both for the versioning of the application code, and for the versioning of the Helm configurations (GitOps).

4.description: I manage the technical teams of xidera, giving my contribution in the company's strategic decisions regarding technical areas. The goal is reduce the technical debt of xidera, internally governing a cultural transition towards the adoption of Agile and DevOps Methodologies and a technical transition with the adoption of the 12-factor paradigm for the development of applications, restructuring the legacy code and introducing tools and technologies that they favor the creation of cloud-native applications

5.description: As a member of the Prima Assicurazioni Infrastructure Team, my role involves managing the infrastructure supporting the company's workloads and building platform tools to enhance developers' experiences. Additionally, I spearhead a teaching initiative aimed at sharing DevOps principles and methodologies within the company to upskill developers on critical Cloud Computing topics and promote the 'you build it, you run it' approach. In 2023, I served as the dedicated Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) responsible for supporting and maintaining the cloud infrastructure specifically for the Claims domain. Tech stack: AWS, K8S, Helm, Docker, Pulumi, Terraform, Cloudformation, Cloudflare, Datadog, ELK Stack, Harness Drone CI, GitHub & GitHub Actions

6.description: As the leader of a team of Site Reliability Engineers, I guide them (>10 people) in supporting the company's goals and coaching developers on infrastructure best practices. Our aim is to increase developer autonomy in managing infrastructure tasks and adhere to the 'you build it, you run it' approach using frameworks like Domain Driven Design and Team Topologies. I oversee team performance, prioritize their growth and well-being, and manage the DevOps Community of Practice, fostering knowledge-sharing among interested Prima employees. Skills: People Management, Delivery management, Strategy definition, Team Topologies, Domain Driven Design, Kanban, Shape Up
